metadata.title: CVE-2021-47373 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:irqchip/gic-v3-its: Fix potential VPE leak on error Inits_vpe_irq_domain_alloc, when its_vpe_init() returns an error, there is anoff-by-one in the number of VPEs to be freed. Fix it by simply passing thenumber of VPEs allocated, which is the index of the loop iterating over theVPEs. [maz: fixed commit message]

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-47373` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-163-generic - 4.15.0-163.171
linux-image-4.15.0-163-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-163.171
linux-image-4.15.0-163-lowlatency - 4.15.0-163.171
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-163-generic - 4.15.0-163.171
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-163-lowlatency - 4.15.0-163.171
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-91-generic - 5.4.0-91.102~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-91-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-91.102~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-91-lowlatency - 5.4.0-91.102~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-91-generic - 5.4.0-91.102~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-91-lowlatency - 5.4.0-91.102~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1103-kvm - 4.15.0-1103.105
No subscription required

No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1060-aws - 5.4.0-1060.63~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1127-azure - 4.15.0-1127.140
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1064-azure - 5.4.0-1064.67~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1112-gcp - 4.15.0-1112.126
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1058-gcp - 5.4.0-1058.62~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1010-ibm - 5.4.0-1010.11~18.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-163.171').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-91.102~18.04.1').

linux-aws package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1116.123').
